private_information: I can only manipulate vowel-labelled blocks: A, E, I.
I can only interact with the top block of a stack.
I can move at most one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Create the target tower where A is on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, and M on the table.

private_information: I can only manipulate consonant-labelled blocks: K, F, D, G, B, H, M, C, L, J.
I can only interact with the top block of a stack.
I can move at most one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Create the target tower where A is on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, and M on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate the two agents to build the final tower A->B->C->D->E->F->G->H->I->J->K->L->M (M on table).

public_information: Blocks present: K, F, D, G, E, A, B, H, M, C, I, L, J.
D is on top of K.
G is on top of D.
A is on top of G.
B is on top of A.
C is on top of B.
L is on top of C.
J is on top of L.
H is on top of E.
M is on top of H.
General rules: Only the top block of any stack can be moved.
General rules: Agents may move only one block at a time.
Goal configuration: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on the table.

report.system_prompt: You are vowel_agent. You are provided with the public environment information and you possess the private constraints listed under your agent profile. Do NOT emit PDDL. Based on the public state, report (1) which vowel-labelled blocks (A, E, I) you are allowed to move now (i.e., which of them are currently top of a stack), (2) for each such accessible vowel block list the legal single-block moves you could perform (place on table or on top of any other block), and (3) any assumptions or missing information needed to plan further. Provide a concise structured description that the orchestrator can consume.

You are consonant_agent. You are provided with the public environment information and you possess the private constraints listed under your agent profile. Do NOT emit PDDL. Based on the public state, report (1) which consonant-labelled blocks you are allowed to move now (i.e., which of them are currently top of a stack), (2) for each such accessible consonant block list the legal single-block moves you could perform (place on table or on top of any other block), and (3) any assumptions or missing information needed to plan further. Provide a concise structured description that the orchestrator can consume.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your role is to take the structured reports from the two agents (info_vowel and info_consonant), integrate them with the public environment information, resolve naming or accessibility issues, keep the actions of the two agents distinct, and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner. The PDDL must explicitly model two agent action types (one for vowel_agent moves, one for consonant_agent moves) so that actions remain distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownwards solver (include any typical requirements or metric statements appropriate for FastDownwards). If information is missing from the agents' reports, make minimal explicit assumptions and document them in comments inside the PDDL problem file.

orchestrator.prompt: You will receive the two agents' structured reports. Integrate them to produce a final PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global goal: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on the table. Keep actions of vowel_agent and consonant_agent distinct. Use the public environment information as the initial state. Be explicit about any assumptions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The target solver is FastDownwards.
